In our application we use the maps of OpenStreetMap, an OpenStreetMap Foundation service, St John\'s Innovation Center, Cowley Road, Cambridge, CB 4 0 WS, United Kingdom, hereinafter referred to as \"OpenStreetMap\". In our application, the service OpenStreetMap is involved, so is stored by OpenStreetMap a cookie on your device. This will process your user settings and user data for the purpose of displaying the page or ensuring the functionality of OpenStreetMap. Through this processing, OpenStreetMap can recognize from which application your request has been sent and to which IP address the data should be transmitted. Legal basis is Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f) GDPR. Our legitimate interest lies in the operation of our application. If you do not agree with this processing, please contact the above mentioned contact persons. OpenStreetMap provides more information at https://wiki.osmfoundation.org/wiki/Privacy_Policy to collect and use the data, and to protect your rights and privacy. We reserve the right to set up our own mirror for OpenStreetMap. In this case, we will delete any generated data as soon as possible and donât link it to our regularly collected data, if possible.

The SimRa project is coordinated with the official data protection at Technische UniversitÃ¤t Berlin. For questions about data protection in the SimRa project, please contact:
 Annette Hiller, Data Protection Official at Technischen UniversitÃ¤t Berlin 
 StraÃe des 17. Juni 135, 10623 Berlin
 Raum H 1038
 
 Tel.: +49 30 314 21784 
 Fax: +49 30 314 28033 
 E–Mail: info@datenschutzbeauftragte@tu–berlin.de 

You also have the right to contact the local controlling authority:
Berliner Beauftragte fÃ¼r Datenschutz und Informationsfreiheit Friedrichstr. 219 / visitor entrance via Puttkamerstr. 16 -18 10969 Berlin Tel.: +49 30 13889-0 Fax: +49 30 2155050 Email: mailbox@datenschutz-berlin.de

Data privacy covers personal data. According to art. 4 par. 1 of DSGVO this are data referring to an identified or identifiable individual, hence all data which could be used to identify you. This applies for data such as name, private address, e-mail address, telephone number but also to usage data such as your IP address. Of course Technische UniversitÃ¤t Berlin observes the legal requirements of data privacy and other applicable regulations. We are committed to ensure that you can trust us concerning your personal data. Therefore transfers of personal or sensitive data are encrypted. In addition our websites are protected against damage and unauthorised access by technical measures.

(1) If you visit a TUB website or download data of these sites, the following information will be stored in a log file: your IP address, date and time of the site access, visited website resp. name of the downloaded file, amount of transferred data, âuser agent-stringâ of your web browser, the website from which you were referred to the current website or file and a status notification of successful or unsuccessful access. The non-anonymised data will be deleted after two weeks and will not be archived. (2) This data will only be used for non-commercial purposes: it will only be reviewed manually if necessary for fault analysis, optimisation or investigation of abuse or performance issues. (3) For data collection and storage we employ cookies. Cookies are small data packets consisting of text and are stored by your web browser upon website visit. They cause no harm on your device â neither do cookies contain viruses nor do they give us the option to spy on you. We employ two types of cookies: session cookies and permanent cookies. Session cookies are deleted when you close your web browser. Permanent cookies have a maximum life time â in our case up to one day. Cookies are employed to ensure an optimal usage of the websites for visitors and editors. The employed cookies are not used for the tracing of personal user activities or analysis of behaviour. They are only employed where there is a technical requirement or they make more sense than other techniques such as the recognition of the login status of visitors and editors or the storage of information such as âdisplay mobile version of the websiteâ. The usage of the websites is possible without cookies most of the time. For features resp. sites which require a login the employment of cookies is necessary. You can configure your web browser to delete stored cookies. (4) Within TUB websites external websites or services are embedded in some cases. The integrated search function refers to a website of the Google for example. In this case only the search terms are transferred. With techniques like âiframesâ external website contents are embedded at certain points. The providers of the websites may register, store and as the case may be process and relay your data. At the very most, these data are so-called traffic data, that is information collected by external service providers as can be collected from visiting any regular website, e.g. the IP address, the approximate location, the browser used, the website you are coming from and so on. In no way are personal information or data collected unless you have voluntarily submitted these via a web form.
Extent of Data Collection and Storage

Please refer to the section on our General Data Policy (see above, regarding login data and cookies) and the chapter on Usage Data (below, further information about cookies andusing Mamoto). For the usage of our websites active registration of your personal data is not necessary in general. For TU Berlin to fulfil requested services, we require personal data in some cases. This applies especially for the individual replying to e-mails, provision of special services or applications. If you entrust us with the supply of a service, we will only register and store your personal data as required for the supply of the service. In some exceptions, e.g. for event registrations, you will be asked whether your data can be stored beyond the event date in order to inform you of similar events. No disadvantages result if you decline this request. You can revoke your consent at any time and without giving reasons and demand the deletion of your data. If you sign up for a newsletter with your e-mail address, we will use your e-mail address in order to inform you within the newsletter until you unsubscribe the newsletter.

Sofern innerhalb des Internetangebotes die MÃ¶glichkeit zur Eingabe persÃ¶nlicher oder geschÃ¤ftlicher Daten (Emailadressen, Namen, Anschriften) besteht, so erfolgt die Preisgabe dieser Daten seitens des Nutzers auf ausdrÃ¼cklich freiwilliger Basis. Die Inanspruchnahme und Bezahlung aller angebotenen Dienste ist - soweit technisch mÃ¶glich und zumutbar - auch ohne Angabe solcher Daten bzw. unter Angabe anonymisierter Daten oder eines Pseudonyms gestattet. Die Nutzung der im Rahmen des Impressums oder vergleichbarer Angaben verÃ¶ffentlichten Kontaktdaten wie Postanschriften, Telefon- und Faxnummern sowie Emailadressen durch Dritte zur Ãbersendung von nicht ausdrÃ¼cklich angeforderten Informationen ist nicht gestattet. Rechtliche Schritte gegen die Versender von so genannten Spam-Mails bei VerstÃ¶Ãen gegen dieses Verbot sind ausdrÃ¼cklich vorbehalten.

Der Herausgeber ist bestrebt, in allen Publikationen die Urheberrechte der verwendeten Bilder, Grafiken, Ton- und Videodokumente sowie Texte zu beachten, von ihm selbst erstellte Bilder, Grafiken, Ton- und Videodokumente sowie Texte zu nutzen oder auf lizenzfreie Grafiken, Ton- und Videodokumente sowie Texte zurÃ¼ckzugreifen. Alle innerhalb des Internetangebotes genannten und ggf. durch Dritte geschÃ¼tzten Marken- und Warenzeichen unterliegen uneingeschrÃ¤nkt den Bestimmungen des jeweils gÃ¼ltigen Kennzeichenrechts und den Besitzrechten der jeweiligen eingetragenen EigentÃ¼mer. Allein aufgrund der bloÃen Nennung ist nicht der Schluss zu ziehen, dass Markenzeichen nicht durch Rechte Dritter geschÃ¼tzt sind! Das Copyright fÃ¼r verÃ¶ffentlichte, vom Herausgeber selbst erstellte Inhalte und Objekte bleibt allein beim Herausgeber der Seiten. Eine VervielfÃ¤ltigung, Verarbeitung, Einspeicherung oder Verwendung solcher Grafiken, Ton- und Videodokumente sowie Texte in anderen elektronischen oder gedruckten Publikationen ist ohne ausdrÃ¼ckliche Zustimmung des Autors nicht gestattet. UnberÃ¼hrt davon bleibt das Kopieren und Herunterladen fÃ¼r den privaten, wissenschaftlichen und nicht kommerziellen Gebrauch. Wir erlauben ausdrÃ¼cklich und begrÃ¼Ãen das Zitieren unserer Dokumente und Webseiten sowie das Setzen von Links auf unsere Website.

Bei direkten oder indirekten Verweisen auf fremde Webseiten (\"Hyperlinks\"), die auÃerhalb des Verantwortungsbereiches des Herausgebers liegen, wÃ¼rde eine Haftungsverpflichtung ausschlieÃlich in dem Fall in Kraft treten, in dem der Herausgeber von den Inhalten Kenntnis hat und es ihm technisch mÃ¶glich und zumutbar wÃ¤re, die Nutzung im Falle rechtswidriger Inhalte zu verhindern. Der Herausgeber erklÃ¤rt hiermit ausdrÃ¼cklich, dass zum Zeitpunkt der Linksetzung keine illegalen Inhalte auf den zu verlinkenden Seiten erkennbar waren. Auf die aktuelle und zukÃ¼nftige Gestaltung, die Inhalte oder die Urheberschaft der verlinkten/verknÃ¼pften Seiten hat der Herausgeber keinerlei Einfluss. Deshalb distanziert er sich hiermit ausdrÃ¼cklich von allen Inhalten aller verlinkten /verknÃ¼pften Seiten, die nach der Linksetzung verÃ¤ndert wurden. Diese Feststellung gilt fÃ¼r alle innerhalb des eigenen Internetangebotes gesetzten Links und Verweise sowie fÃ¼r FremdeintrÃ¤ge in vom Autor eingerichteten GÃ¤stebÃ¼chern, Diskussionsforen, Linkverzeichnissen, Mailinglisten und in allen anderen Formen von Datenbanken, auf deren Inhalt externe Schreibzugriffe mÃ¶glich sind. FÃ¼r illegale, fehlerhafte oder unvollstÃ¤ndige Inhalte und insbesondere fÃ¼r SchÃ¤den, die aus der Nutzung oder Nichtnutzung solcherart dargebotener Informationen entstehen, haftet allein der Anbieter der Seite, auf welche verwiesen wurde, nicht derjenige, der Ã¼ber Links auf die jeweilige VerÃ¶ffentlichung lediglich verweist.

Die Inhalte dieser Applikation werden mit grÃ¶ÃtmÃ¶glicher Sorgfalt recherchiert und implementiert. Fehler im Bearbeitungsvorgang sind dennoch nicht auszuschlieÃen. Bei Hinweisen und Korrekturen wenden Sie sich bitte an die genannten Ansprechpartner. Der Herausgeber Ã¼bernimmt keinerlei GewÃ¤hr fÃ¼r die AktualitÃ¤t, Korrektheit, VollstÃ¤ndigkeit oder QualitÃ¤t der bereitgestellten Informationen. HaftungsansprÃ¼che gegen den Herausgeber, welche sich auf SchÃ¤den materieller oder ideeller Art beziehen, die durch die Nutzung oder Nichtnutzung der dargebotenen Informationen bzw. durch die Nutzung fehlerhafter und unvollstÃ¤ndiger Informationen verursacht wurden, sind grundsÃ¤tzlich ausgeschlossen, sofern seitens des Herausgebers kein nachweislich vorsÃ¤tzliches oder grob fahrlÃ¤ssiges Verschulden vorliegt. Alle Angebote sind freibleibend und unverbindlich. Der Herausgeber behÃ¤lt es sich ausdrÃ¼cklich vor, Teile der Applikation oder das gesamte Angebot ohne gesonderte AnkÃ¼ndigung zu verÃ¤ndern, zu ergÃ¤nzen, zu lÃ¶schen oder die VerÃ¶ffentlichung zeitweise oder endgÃ¼ltig einzustellen.

Die Technische UniversitÃ¤t Berlin ist eine KÃ¶rperschaft Ã¶ffentlichen Rechts gemÃ¤Ã Â§Â§ 1 und 2 des Berliner Hochschulgesetzes (BerlHG) und zugleich eine staatliche Einrichtung. Sie wird durch den PrÃ¤sidenten gesetzlich vertreten. Der Name \"Technische UniversitÃ¤t Berlin\" wird nicht ins Englische Ã¼bersetzt.

Technische UniversitÃ¤t Berlin

 StraÃe des 17. Juni 135

The airplane mode is enabled! Please disable it, so the ride can be recorded.
The locaation service is disabled! Please enable it, so the ride can be recorded.
After the ride gets changed, new incidents will be calculated and previous incidents of this ride and their annotations will be deleted.
I accept the privacy policy statement
SimRa records your location and sensor data, as well as demographics provided by you. For more information please read our privacy policy statement).
Please agree to our data privacy policy, otherwise you cannot upload your rides.

In the research project SimRa, we collect data to get an overview of cycling near accidents in Berlin. We collect data about driving routes, acceleration data, your ride annotations and some demographic data. The goal is, to get informationâs about the distribution of time, place and type of dangerous situations while cycling. One of our main goals is to protect your privacy, therefor we individually pseudonymizing your rides and storing them separately from the likewise pseudonymised demographic data.

All in the research project SimRa collected data, is aiming for getting an overview of cycling near accidents in Berlin. Together with cooperation partners in other cities, we collect data in other cities in the same way. Specifically, we collect the following data:

\t1 Routes: We use the GPS module and the location services of your smartphone to record the journey. We store your current position every 10 seconds. \n
\t2 Acceleration values: We use the acceleration sensors of your smartphone. These continuously values describe the respective acceleration in the X, Y and Z directions. We record these in the form of three time series.\n
\t3 Annotated rides: Based on the acceleration values, we determine probable danger points, you can supplement other danger points and annotate them. In annotation, we request, e.g. the type of event or how endangered you felt. Please do not enter any personal data, such as names or contact details in free text fields, otherwise we wonât be able to ensure your anonymity. Additionally, we request informationâs like your bike type. \n
\t4 Demographic data: In order to classify the collected informationâs on routes and near accidents compared to representative data sets from cycler (e.g. age distribution surveys), we collect some demographic data. These are queried in the corresponding submenu. In addition to your user input, we also store aggregated information about your rides, e.g. the total distance covered, the date of your first and last uploaded ride, the number of your rides, the number of annotated dangerous situations. All informationâs in this regard is showed in the corresponding menu. \n
\t5 Meta data: To develop the app, we Capture some meta informationâs. These are transmitted to us during regular data transmissions - e.g. while uploading rides or while uploading your demographic data. As meta data we record the app version that is used and the version of your dataset (if you update it). We reserve the right to store connection data such as your IP address momentarily (less than a week) to prevent server attacks. We store data from real or perceived attackers permanent. After app crashes, you have the option to submit an error log to us. Usually this logfile donât contain any personal data. Apart from mentioned information, we do not collect any device ID or similar informationâs, that could determine your device. \n
\t6 E-mails: If you contact us by e-mail or via feedback, we will save these e-mails as usual. For this we refer to the general data protection information of the Technische UniversitÃ¤t Berlin (https://www.tu-berlin.de/allgemeine_seiten/datenschutz/).

All collected data will be used for research purposes. We plan to publish the data on routes and dangerous situations as freely accessible public dataset, which we do, after the best possible anonymization (see also the information to personal data in point 3). On base of this data, e.g. traffic flows for cycling can be optimized and dangerous places defused. Further uses, like routing around danger centres or audible warnings while driving, are possible. Because the data collected in this research project will be freely available, any uses are possible.

In addition to the usual mechanisms of IT security, we ensure your privacy through anonymization. This is particularly done whereby following mechanisms: \t1 Individual pseudonymisation of the rides: Each ride is individually pseudonymised, thereby a combination of several rides, is not possible for us. Technically, this means that each ride data set (consisting of GPS route, acceleration data and annotation data) is first transmitted to us in a file. Our servers then create an identifier (similar to a file name) and a random access key and send it to your app. This identifier and access key are stored in your smartphone thereby you can view your trips at any time. This means for us, that we cannot create cross-driving links, because we donât have any data about which smartphone or user the ride belongs to. We only can say, that there is a ride from place A to place B every day at the same time, but we cannot say, if this is the same person. This is particularly true in high populated regions. If you start your rides alone in a house with a clear distance to other houses, an assignment with additional knowledge may be possible. Here we refer to the possibilities from point 3 below.\n \t2 Pseudonymisation of demographic data: The demographic data uploaded by you gets individually pseudonymized as the individual rides, technically this is implemented comparably. This means that linking your demographic data with your rides is not possible. Before being published as a public dataset, we will explicitly verify that the demographic information does not uniquely identify anyone and, if necessary, further aggregate the data.\n \t3 Trimming rides: After recording a ride you can cut off your ride at both ends - you can freely define the part that will be removed; this will not be sent to us per upload and gets permanently deleted instead. In high populated cities, your trip should usually be sufficiently anonymized without trimming, especially because informationâs if a ride got trimmed or not, isnât saved at all. In more rural areas, you should use this feature specifically. But we would ask you to donât overuse the function, as excessive use can reduce the validity of the collected data.

Further information to data privacy, data collection and data utilisation on the Button below. Third parties arenât allowed to use in the app published data, like address, phone number, fax number or mail address, to send unrequested information. We reserve to take legal steps against sender from spam mails.
Cut off the beginning or the end of the ride
This ride hasn\t been uploaded yet. Do you want to delete the ride anyway?
